item.title: SMILE
item.description: SMILE 2017, Photography

item.title: C-EP CONSUMER SERVICES
item.description: C-EP CONSUMER SERVICES Service Design | 2017, Professiona Work Objective Which direction should the electric power company aim for? In 2016, full-scale deregulation of the electricity industry in Japan has begun, and a lot of new and emerging companies have entered the electricity market. Chubu Electric Power Company (C-EPCO), a Japanese electricity utility provider for the mid-Chubu region of Honshu island, Japan, must shift to a new paradigm of customer service in order to improve its retention capability.

item.title: IBM Watson cognitive enterprise app
item.description: IBM Watson cognitive enterprise app Enterprise Application Design | 2016, Professional Work Objective How can MHI engineers make the RFP inspection process more effectively? RFP inspection is important work for Mitsubishi Heavy Industries, Ltd. (MHI) engineers to estimate risks in advance and deliver the project in a healthy way. However, it needs much knowledge and takes long time to do it accurately under the pressure of a deadline.

item.title: FICTIONAL REAL, REAL FICTION
item.description: FICTIONAL REAL, REAL FICTION 2016, Photography Facts like fiction and fiction like facts. I am seeking for something on the border of them both. Which side are we living on? Publication EINSTEIN STUDIO ARCHIVES, Compilation book of Japanese young photographers, 2016

item.title: PHOTOGRAPHY 100Y AFTER
item.description: This is the normal way of life in the 22nd century. Children is playing in a "virtual forest". Are these images our future dreamed life? This is the normal way of life in the 22nd century. I reviewed my lifemoment archives and found my external memory failed to save one second of my life. What will be the difference between our ''memories’’ and ''records‘‘? This is the normal way of life in the 22nd century.

item.title: FUTURE SUPERMARKET DESIGN INAGEYA
item.description: FUTURE SUPERMARKET DESIGN INAGEYA Business Design | 2016, Professional Work Objective What should Inageya do to go “beyond” supermarket? Inagea is a long-established supermarket in Japan. However, in a situation that society and family structures are changing, a role of supermarket also needs to change in Japan. Clients were struggling for planning a strong concept of a next-generation supermarket in 2020 with consideration for a sustainable ecosystem from producers to consumers and of course customer-first.

item.title: Uber UX RESEARCH AND DESIGN
item.description: UBER UX RESEARCH AND DESIGN UX/UI Design | 2015, Academic Work Objective How can we improve the experience of Uber drivers? Joined 5 weeks MFA Interaction Design Program of User Research Methods in SVA, US. Woriking in teams, we’ve joined a real project with Uber and proposed UX to solve current issues. I’ve learned the fundamentals of user research techniques and the sense of UX in collaboration with global students.

item.title: LimpiDual Touch
item.description: LIMPIDUAL TOUCH Interaction Design | 2009, Academic Work Objective What if we can display information on a transparent surface? Direct-touch input enables intuitive operation, and touch panels have been mounted on various devices. However, finger occlusion becomes one of the problems when a user touches the display from the front side. Here, inspired from SF movies, one idea to solve this problem is to use “transparent” display. Additionally, we can imagine various scenarios if we can display information on a transparent surface.

item.title: Daifuku Experience
item.description: DAIFUKU EXPERIENCE UX/UI Design | 2015, Professiona Work Objective How does DAIFUKU build a globally unified brand? Clients thought their website was becoming obsolete and wanted to enhance their brand using current web technologies and user-centered disciplines. And Daifuku has 20 branches in the world, so they wanted to provide global integrated contents and operations. Appproach Redesigned DAIFUKU corporate website and operations Based on a service design approach, we designed and proposed from a business organization to UX / UI and an infrastructure.

item.title: Interface Critique
item.description: Interface Critique Research | 2018, Academic Work I picked up an umbrella for critiquing as an interface. An umbrella or parasol is designed to protect a person against rain or sunlight. It is said that an umbrella has been used about 4000 years ago and remains in sculptures such as Egypt, Persia, and mural paintings. In many regions, umbrellas have developed to protect the king from sunlight, so they have long been a luxury item, a symbol of wealth and power.

item.title: 1D: Identiy Digitalizing
item.description: 1D: Identiy Digitalizing Storytelling | 2018, Academic Work

item.title: Speculative Thinking
item.description: Speculative Thinking Design Research | 2016, Personal Work My Design Policy Speculative Fusion of Design and Science The following chart is my own thought of the speculative fusion of design and science. In the business field, we have been creating probable futures using industrial solutions. Currently, through a collaboration with designers, technologists and business strategists, we can imagine and develop further plausible futures based on emerging technologies. Additionally, we must speculate possible futures that research-level technologies promise, and discuss the cultural and political mechanisms behind them to overcome our 21st-century problems.

item.title: SANJA FESTIVAL
item.description: Sanja Festival 2017, Photography Sanja Matsuri (三社祭, literally “Three Shrine Festival”), or Sanja Festival, is one of the three great Shinto festivals in Tokyo. It is considered one of the wildest and largest. The festival is held in honor of the three men who established and founded Sensō-ji. Sanja Matsuri is held on the third weekend of every May at Asakusa Shrine.

item.title: Artificial Ephemerality
item.description: Artificial Ephemerality Generative Art | 2018, Academic Work Objective How do we express “ephemerality” artificially? -- - Press "S" to save the current screenshot to your desktop. - Press "T" to turn on/off the music. - Press "P" to pause the generation process. Phase Concept, Design, Build Period 08/2018 (1 Week) Team Sole Project Role Maker, Coder What I did Define Experience Concept -- Method

item.title: IBM JAPAN DESIGNER'S BOARD
item.description: IBM JAPAN DESIGNER'S BOARD Graphic Design | 2016, Professional Work Objective How might IBM designers express our new design culture? Phase Concept, Develop, Deliver Period 12/2015 - 01/2016 Team Sole Project Role Graphic Designer What I did Define Experience Concept -- Method IBM Design Thinking Output Profile Board Product Golive 01/2016 - until now Approach Designed the profile board to show talents in the Tokyo Studio Result Apply to the atmosphere of our Tokyo studio Design Process Starting point was a respect to the traditional IBM philosophy Additionally, we reflect new IBM design culture 1st & 2nd prototype 3nd prototype Physical prototype and finalizing

item.title: IBM Corporate Service Corps
item.description: IBM Corporate Service Corps Business Strategy Design | 2014, Professional Work Objective How do we build a preferable future vision on a social level? IBM CSC(Corporate Service Corp) is one-month pro bono consulting program for developing countries addressing Energy, Economic Development, Transportation, Education, and Healthcare. I participated in the IBM pro bono Corporate Service Corps, addressing social issues in developing countries. I was one of a cross-border global IBM team in Mexico that sought to tackle the problems of gender violence by collaborating with IAPEM (the Mexico State Public Administration).
